lexUnit.name: delay.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause to become late or slow or postpone or defer.

sentence.text: ` Our information is that Mr Evans left the Club in order to go and see what was delaying the arrival of his wife whom he had been expecting for some time . "
Knowing what he would find when he went there , and knowing that it would pain him , Edouard delayed the moment when he would make a formal inspection of the house .
She reached for the glass , delaying the moment when she 'd have to answer , unsure even how to answer .
It would seem reasonable to call a drug an analgesic for a rat if it delays the time when the rat licks its feet when parked on a hot plate .
Was autumn further delayed to allow six party conferences one after the other ?
The problem came to light when an ambulance was delayed attending an emergency at Harwood-in-Teesdale , just before Christmas .
Owner-occupiers tend to delay childbearing because they face heavy housing costs at the beginning of their marriage .

Eventually the time came when she could n't delay going downstairs any longer , and when she reached the kitchen she discovered that the visitor had left , and that Silas was examining the contents of the fridge .
Bradford Northern coach Peter Fox has delayed naming his side for tomorrow 's Trophy quarter-final against Widnes but Great Britain scrum-half Deryck Fox is definitely out .
RUGBY UNION : Scotland have delayed naming their team for Saturday 's international against world champions Australia amid continuing doubts over the fitness of full back Gavin Hastings .
Do not delay requesting veterinary attention for any young foal which is not sucking and has diarrhoea .
I delayed switching the computer off while I racked my brain trying to think of some way of saving them , but there was none .
At their meeting in either 1749 or 1750 , Christopher Smart accepted this task from Richardson ; however , he delayed writing the piece which was to be printed in the volume .
She rattled on breathlessly , perhaps encouraged , Dexter thought , by a desire to delay Blanche coming to the point of the meeting .
Corporate lawyers managed to delay the case coming to court for two years and then they prolonged the proceedings for a further two years .
The crisis over aid to eastern Bosnia has delayed the peace negotiations taking place at the United Nations .
A HOME OFFICE minister yesterday intervened at the last minute to delay a Kurdish refugee being flown back to Turkey .
So he was delaying beginning to play .
But the government front bench denied opposition claims that they 'd deliberately delayed the decision to boost Tory support on the eve of the Party Conference .
Consequently , field social workers delayed the decision to admit young people to care , and , subsequently , were forced to do so when events had overtaken them .

Glaxo has since delayed the launch to await product approvals but it 's a massive project and will take out rigid packaging business forward very quickly when it comes on stream -- probably late this year .
Race officials claim the start of the run had been delayed 20 minutes to avoid the train but the race was running 10 minutes ahead of schedule .
The new discovery , of weakness in welded joints , may delay plans to reopen the plant 's two reactors .
SALVAGE specialists were forced yesterday to delay plans to refloat the Danish cargo ship aground on an island in the Pentland Firth .
Researchers at NASA claim that even if the sulphur effect does exist , it could at most only delay the greenhouse effect until fossil fuels run out .
They were , however , encouraged to delay their accident estimate until they had thought specifically about how busy the junction would normally be and how it might appear in other conditions .
SOUTH AFRICA 'S National Party government and the African National Congress agreed yesterday on a course that could delay majority black government until the end of the century .
The problem has delayed the second phase by 18 months .
Hurworth dentist Simon Allum said : ` Despite the Government delaying the decision by a month we still have not been answered .
The first one was to the house in Colchester to ask if they 'd mind if I delayed my arrival by one more day .
He delayed the trip by two days , arrived in London on 8 June , and went into a series of meetings with the Commons committee , Sir Geoffrey , Mrs Thatcher and the Press .
For the first time in their history the Tuareg -- the largest tribe of Nomads in the Sahara Desert -- recently delayed their annual migration for 10 days so as to catch the final episode of Dallas
A commonly held view is that he delayed withdrawal for political reasons , until after the presidential elections of December 1965 .
Or maybe that is an apocryphal story and she thought about delaying the journey for twenty-four hours because she had a hair appointment .
Paul Reichmann asked me to delay everything for two months and I agreed .
Many women have been delaying births for years .
It must be sensible to delay breeding until the mare has had a chance to prove herself as a sound , willing ride .
We could have delayed the trial until the tax business was settled .
One bonus of delaying an election until 1992 would be that Mr Major could use a summer reshuffle to continue reshaping the government he inherited from Mrs Thatcher .
The Swedish government announced in mid-January that it would delay a promised phase-out of nuclear power until alternative energy sources became viable .
Deeper hard pans require more drastic operations such as double digging ; in established gardens you may prefer to delay the upheaval until each area affected is due for renewal and replanting .
Huy had delayed telling Merymose about Surere , waiting for the right moment to come .
But the experiment was delayed a day because of the strike .
The incident delayed the Wardair Airbus on its flight to Toronto by three hours 11 minutes and she asked for compensation of more than £1,500 .

Friends of the Earth urged the government to delay any decision on Thorp until after the advisory committee completes its review of radioactive waste disposal for the next 20 years , which is expected next year .
Security forces delayed 50 hours before searching the region , allowing the murderers to escape the net .
Similarly , stock shortages delay deliveries , hold up contracts , lose customers and cause money problems .
That 's why I delayed coming home .
In Zambia , such procedures have delayed the purchase of essential new equipment .
Concealing the body might have delayed the scheme , but not aborted it .
“ I 'm going to delay them . ”
I have been delaying you .
Who will pay compensation if one operators ' trains are delayed by a breakdown of a train by another operator ?
Traffic disruption and a shortage of change at the turnstiles saw the kick-off delayed by 15 minutes .

Further studies were delaying by two years measures to save Lake Ichkeul in Tunisia , which was in danger of being reduced to a salty lagoon after the damming in the 1970s of the six rivers feeding it .
The Coronations were launched by an ever-publicity-conscious Luff , shortly before his retirement , which he delayed until 1954 .
` Saturday 's situation appears to have been caused because people delayed before going out into the rain . "
Maybe if he could delay a little longer , Springfield would discover his sweep had failed to capture the ringleader and send men in to flush him out .
Some fear that if Mr Mieno delays much longer , he risks overkill .
Consequently , he wants the Government to delay no longer , but to begin to devolve real responsibility to the people of Northern Ireland .
He sent an army under Counts Hugh and Matfrid to help Bernard ; but the two commanders delayed so long en route that Muslim troops were able to ravage the county of Barcelona .
But she discovered she had delayed too long , for as she reached the hall , there before her , and as cool as you like , was Naylor .
